question: Which of the following is NOT a type of operating system?

options: A. To represent a process in the operating system
B. To store the program code for a process
C. To manage the memory allocation for a process
D. To handle the input and output for a process

question: Which scheduling algorithm schedules processes based on their shortest burst time?
What is the difference between a semaphore and a mutex?
options: A. Semaphores can be used for both mutual exclusion and synchronization
while mutexes are only used for mutual exclusion
B. Mutexes can be used for both mutual exclusion and synchronization
while semaphores are only used for synchronization
C. Semaphores are used for mutual exclusion
while mutexes are used for synchronization
D. There is no difference between a semaphore and a mutex

question: What is the purpose of deadlock prevention?
options: A. To prevent deadlocks from occurring
B. To detect and recover from deadlocks
D. To handle deadlocks by preemption

question: Which of the following is a page replacement algorithm?
What is the difference between seek time and rotational latency?
options: A. Seek time is the time it takes to move the disk arm to a specific track
while rotational latency is the time it takes for the desired sector to rotate into position
B. Rotational latency is the time it takes to move the disk arm to a specific track
while seek time is the time it takes for the desired sector to rotate into position
C. Seek time and rotational latency are the same thing

question: Which disk scheduling algorithm moves the disk arm in a specific direction and services requests in its path?
What is the purpose of virtual memory?
options: A. To allow processes to execute outside of physical memory
B. To improve the performance of the operating system
